payload.instructions:
# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` – FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` – Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` – Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` – Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` – Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` – Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` – Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` – Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` – Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` – End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` – Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.

# Repository Guidelines

## Project Structure & Module Organization
- `apps/api/` – FastAPI services, routes, config, and database layer (`apps/api/services`, `apps/api/routes`).
- `apps/web/` – Next.js front-end (`pages/`, `lib/`, `styles/`) with shared components under `components/`.
- `apps/worker/` – Prefect flows, ingestion jobs, and maintenance tasks (e.g., `poc_pipeline.py`, `maintenance/retention.py`).
- `shared/` – Cross-cutting libraries (connectors, data-context, feature store, storage helpers, schemas).
- `tests/` – Pytest suites mirroring module layout; integration tests live alongside unit tests.
- `docs/` – Living product docs (`ROADMAP.md`, `DEVELOPMENT.md`, etc.).

## Build, Test, and Development Commands
- `make api` / `make web` / `make worker` – Run API, front-end, and worker dev servers with hot reload.
- `make lint` – Execute Ruff + ESLint checks.
- `make test` – Run Python pytest suites (API, worker, shared libs).
- `make smoke-context` – End-to-end synthetic run exercising data-context tagging.
- `python apps/worker/run.py tenant-id` – Launch Plan & Proof pipeline; append `--retention-only` or `--retention-after` for retention sweeps.

## Coding Style & Naming Conventions
- Python: PEP 8 with Ruff/Black defaults; prefer snake_case for functions/variables, PascalCase for classes.
- TypeScript/React: JSX with ESLint/Prettier settings; camelCase for functions/props, PascalCase for components.
- YAML/JSON: two-space indent, kebab-case keys for deployment manifests (e.g., `deployments/retention.yaml`).

## Testing Guidelines
- Pytest drives back-end and worker tests; Next.js relies on Jest/Playwright when added.
- Name tests `test_<module>.py` and mirror source hierarchy.
- Run targeted suites via `PYTHONPATH=.deps:. pytest tests/<path>`; prefer marking integration tests with `@pytest.mark.asyncio` where needed.
- Maintain coverage for critical flows: ingestion, modeling, allocator, API serialization.

## Commit & Pull Request Guidelines
- Write commits in present tense with concise scope tags (e.g., `worker: add retention webhook`); group related changes.
- Ensure commits lint and test clean locally before pushing.
- PRs should include: summary of changes, test evidence (`make test` output or screenshots for UI), linked Jira/GitHub issues, and rollout notes if config/secrets change.
- Request review from owners of touched modules (`apps/api`, `apps/web`, `shared/`); tag security/data stewards when modifying retention or connector logic.

## Security & Configuration Tips
- Secrets (Shopify tokens, OAuth creds) live in environment variables; never commit `.env` files.
- Use `JsonStateStore` for connector cursors and verify geocoding coverage metrics before enabling Autopilot for a tenant.

Operate autonomously as the WeatherVane super-team. Your goal is to drive the roadmap to completion with world-class engineering, data/ML, product, and design rigor.

Current surprise QA ledger:
- No surprise QA audits recorded yet.

Loop:
1. Read state/roadmap.yaml and choose the highest-priority task(s) not done.
2. Call  to refresh the audit ledger for this session.
3. Run  as a lightweight heartbeat; checkpoint if resource limits appear tight.
4. For each chosen task:
   a. Audit docs/code/tests/design to understand requirements.
   b. Implement the work via fs_read/fs_write/cmd_run (code + tests + docs + design polish). Keep slices small enough to verify quickly.
   c. Run critics_run with ["build","tests","manager_self_check","data_quality","design_system","org_pm","exec_review","health_check","human_sync"] and add allocator/causal/forecast critics when relevant. Use state/critics timestamps/results (including git_sha metadata) to skip suites that have already covered unchanged artifacts this session; rerun when the commit changes or after meaningful edits.
   d. Fix issues. If blocked, log the blocker clearly and mark the task blocked with plan_update.
   e. Record decisions, risks, and next actions via context_write (keep state/context.md <= 1000 words).
   f. Snapshot via context_snapshot.
   g. Update roadmap status with plan_update only after exit criteria are satisfied.
   h. For work expected to run longer than ~5 minutes, queue it with heavy_queue_enqueue (include command/context), monitor via heavy_queue_list, and update status with heavy_queue_update while continuing other work.
5. Prioritise shipping real work over repeated self-review loops while still running critics after meaningful changes land; if nothing changed, move forward instead of re-running the same suites.
6. Approximately once every 100 tasks/messages, deliberately audit a completed roadmap item for hidden gaps or regressions. After each surprise QA, call autopilot_record_audit with task_id/focus/notes and, if issues emerge, open fresh tasks to land fixes before resuming new work.
7. Spread surprise QA audits across different epics/milestones rather than clustering; skip the audit if you already inspected that item in the current session.
8. Repeat on remaining tasks. Stop only when no further progress is possible without human intervention.
Maintain production readiness, enforce ML/causal rigor, polish UX, and communicate like a Staff+/startup leader.
Return JSON summarizing completed tasks, tasks still in progress, blockers, next focus items, and overall notes.

{
  "path": "apps/worker/flows/experiment_pipeline.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Generate geo holdout experiments and persist results.\"\"\"\n\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom datetime import datetime, timedelta\nfrom typing import Dict\n\nfrom prefect import flow, get_run_logger, task\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom apps.worker.flows.poc_pipeline import TenantContext, fetch_shopify_data\nfrom apps.validation.incrementality import summarise_experiment\nfrom apps.worker.validation.incrementality import (\n    design_experiment_from_orders,\n    summarise_experiment_from_orders,\n    write_experiment_results,\n)\n\n\n@task(name=\"Load incrementality design\")\ndef load_design(shopify_payload: Dict[str, object], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    return design_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, context)\n\n\n@task(name=\"Compute experiment summary\")\ndef compute_summary(assigned: Dict[str, object], observations: pl.DataFrame) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    estimate = summarise_experiment(observations, value_column=\"revenue\")\n    return {\n        \"lift\": estimate.lift,\n        \"absolute_lift\": estimate.absolute_lift,\n        \"p_value\": estimate.p_value,\n        \"conf_low\": estimate.conf_low,\n        \"conf_high\": estimate.conf_high,\n        \"treatment_mean\": estimate.treatment_mean,\n        \"control_mean\": estimate.control_mean,\n        \"sample_size_treatment\": estimate.sample_size_treatment,\n        \"sample_size_control\": estimate.sample_size_control,\n    }\n\n\n@flow(name=\"weathervane-incrementality\")\nasync def orchestrate_incrementality_flow(tenant_id: str, start_date: datetime | None = None, end_date: datetime | None = None) -> Dict[str, object]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    if end_date is None:\n        end_date = datetime.utcnow()\n    if start_date is None:\n        start_date = end_date - timedelta(days=365)\n\n    context = TenantContext(tenant_id=tenant_id, start_date=start_date, end_date=end_date)\n    shopify_payload = await fetch_shopify_data(context)\n    design = design_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, context)\n    payload = {\n        \"design\": design,\n        \"generated_at\": datetime.utcnow().isoformat(),\n    }\n    summary = summarise_experiment_from_orders(shopify_payload, design)\n    if summary is not None:\n        payload[\"summary\"] = summary\n\n    write_experiment_results(tenant_id, payload)\n    logger.info(\"Stored incrementality design for %s\", tenant_id)\n    return {\"design\": design, \"summary\": summary}\n"
}

```json
{
  "path": "shared/feature_store/feature_generators.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Feature engineering utilities for WeatherVane feature store.\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass, field\nfrom typing import Iterable, List, Sequence\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\n\nNUMERIC_DTYPES = {\n    pl.Int8,\n    pl.Int16,\n    pl.Int32,\n    pl.Int64,\n    pl.UInt8,\n    pl.UInt16,\n    pl.UInt32,\n    pl.UInt64,\n    pl.Float32,\n    pl.Float64,\n}\n\n\ndef _is_numeric_dtype(dtype: pl.DataType) -> bool:\n    try:\n        return dtype in NUMERIC_DTYPES\n    except TypeError:\n        return False\n\n\n@dataclass(frozen=True)\nclass LagRollingSpec:\n    \"\"\"Configuration describing lag and rolling window features for one column.\"\"\"\n\n    column: str\n    lags: Sequence[int] = field(default_factory=lambda: (1,))\n    rolling_windows: Sequence[int] = field(default_factory=lambda: (7,))\n    rolling_stat: str = \"mean\"\n    alias_prefix: str | None = None\n\n    def feature_name(self, kind: str, value: int) -> str:\n        base = self.alias_prefix or self.column\n        return f\"{base}_{kind}{value}\"\n\n\nclass LagRollingFeatureGenerator:\n    \"\"\"Generate lagged and rolling window features with deterministic ordering.\"\"\"\n\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        specs: Iterable[LagRollingSpec],\n        *,\n        date_col: str = \"date\",\n        group_cols: Sequence[str] | None = None,\n        seed: int = 42,\n        min_periods: int = 1,\n    ) -> None:\n        self.specs: List[LagRollingSpec] = list(specs)\n        self.date_col = date_col\n        self.group_cols = list(group_cols or [])\n        self.seed = int(seed)\n        self.min_periods = max(1, int(min_periods))\n\n    def transform(self, frame: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        \"\"\"Return a new frame including lag/rolling features.\"\"\"\n\n        if frame.is_empty() or not self.specs:\n            return frame\n\n        if self.date_col not in frame.columns:\n            raise KeyError(f\"Expected date column `{self.date_col}` in feature matrix\")\n\n        working = frame.clone()\n        working = working.with_columns(\n            pl.arange(0, pl.len(), eager=False).alias(\"__wvo_row_nr\")\n        )\n\n        try:\n            working = working.with_columns(\n                pl.col(self.date_col)\n                .str.strptime(pl.Date, strict=False)\n                .alias(\"__wvo_date\"),\n            )\n        except pl.exceptions.InvalidOperationError:\n            working = working.with_columns(\n                pl.col(self.date_col).cast(pl.Date, strict=False).alias(\"__wvo_date\"),\n            )\n\n        order_cols = [col for col in self.group_cols if col in working.columns]\n        seed_rank = np.random.default_rng(self.seed).random(working.height)\n        working = working.with_columns(\n            pl.Series(\"__wvo_seed_rank\", seed_rank.tolist())\n        )\n        order_cols.extend([\"__wvo_date\", \"__wvo_seed_rank\", \"__wvo_row_nr\"])\n        working = working.sort(order_cols)\n\n        over_cols = [col for col in self.group_cols if col in working.columns]\n        expressions: List[pl.Expr] = []\n\n        for spec in self.specs:\n            if spec.column not in working.columns:\n                continue\n            dtype = working.schema[spec.column]\n            if not _is_numeric_dtype(dtype):\n                continue\n\n            base_expr = pl.col(spec.column)\n            for lag in spec.lags:\n                if lag <= 0:\n                    continue\n                lag_expr = base_expr.shift(lag)\n                if over_cols:\n                    lag_expr = lag_expr.over(over_cols)\n                expressions.append(lag_expr.alias(spec.feature_name(\"lag\", lag)))\n\n            for window in spec.rolling_windows:\n                if window <= 0:\n                    continue\n                stat = spec.rolling_stat.lower()\n                if stat == \"sum\":\n                    roll_expr = base_expr.rolling_sum(\n                        window_size=window, min_samples=self.min_periods\n                    )\n                elif stat == \"std\":\n                    roll_expr = base_expr.rolling_std(\n                        window_size=window, min_samples=max(self.min_periods, 2)\n                    )\n                else:\n                    roll_expr = base_expr.rolling_mean(\n                        window_size=window, min_samples=self.min_periods\n                    )\n                if over_cols:\n                    roll_expr = roll_expr.over(over_cols)\n                expressions.append(roll_expr.alias(spec.feature_name(\"roll\", window)))\n\n        if expressions:\n            working = working.with_columns(expressions)\n\n        return working.drop(\n            [\"__wvo_seed_rank\", \"__wvo_date\", \"__wvo_row_nr\"]\n        )\n\n    @staticmethod\n    def default_specs() -> List[LagRollingSpec]:\n        \"\"\"Default configuration used by the feature builder.\"\"\"\n\n        return [\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"net_revenue\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"meta_spend\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"sum\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"google_spend\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"sum\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"meta_conversions\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7,),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"google_conversions\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7,),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"promos_sent\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"sum\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"temp_c\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"precip_mm\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7, 14),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"temp_anomaly\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7,),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n                alias_prefix=\"temp_anom\",\n            ),\n            LagRollingSpec(\n                column=\"precip_anomaly\",\n                lags=(1, 7),\n                rolling_windows=(7,),\n                rolling_stat=\"mean\",\n                alias_prefix=\"precip_anom\",\n            ),\n        ]\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

datetime\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Dict, List\n\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom shared.libs.storage.lake import LakeWriter, read_parquet\nfrom shared.validation.schemas import validate_feature_matrix\nfrom shared.data_context.models import DatasetProfile, build_profile_from_polars\nfrom shared.feature_store.feature_generators import LagRollingFeatureGenerator\n\nREQUIRED_WEATHER_COLS = {\n    \"temp_c\",\n    \"precip_mm\",\n    \"temp_anomaly\",\n    \"precip_anomaly\",\n    \"temp_roll7\",\n    \"precip_roll7\",\n}\n\nTARGET_COLUMN = \"net_revenue\"\n\n\nclass FeatureLeakageError(RuntimeError):\n    \"\"\"Raised when the feature matrix contains potential label leakage.\"\"\"\n\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        tenant_id: str,\n        start: datetime,\n        end: datetime,\n        *,\n        leakage_rows: int,\n        leakage_dates: List[str],\n        forward_rows: tenant_id\n        self.start = start\n        self.end = end\n        self.leakage_rows = leakage_rows\n        self.leakage_dates = leakage_dates\n        self.forward_rows = forward_rows\n        self.forward_dates = forward_dates\n        self.forecast_rows = forecast_rows\n        self.forecast_dates = forecast_dates\n        self.matrix = matrix\n        summary = (\n            f\"Potential leakage detected for tenant={tenant_id} \"\n            f\"window=[{start.date().isoformat()}, {end.date().isoformat()}]: \"\n            f\"total_rows={leakage_rows}, forward_rows={forward_rows}, forecast_rows={forecast_rows}, \"\n            f\"dates={leakage_dates}\"\n        )\n        super().__init__(summary)\n\n    def as_dict(self) -> Dict[str, List[str] | int | str]:\n        return {\n            \"tenant_id\": self.tenant_id,\n            \"start\": self.start.isoformat(),\n            \"end\": self.end.isoformat(),\n            \"leakage_rows\": self.matrix.frame.height if self.matrix else None,\n        }\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass FeatureMatrix:\n    frame: pl.DataFrame\n    observed_frame: pl.DataFrame\n    orders_rows: int\n    ads_rows: int\n    promo_rows: int\n    weather_rows: int\n    observed_rows: int\n    latest_observed_date: str | None\n    profiles: Dict[str, DatasetProfile]\n    leakage_risk_rows: int\n    leakage_risk_dates: List[str]\n    forward_leakage_rows: int\n    forward_leakage_dates: List[str]\n    forecast_leakage_rows: int\n    forecast_leakage_dates: List[str]\n\n\nclass FeatureBuilder:\n    def __init__(\n        self,\n        lake_root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/lake/raw\"),\n        feature_seed: int = 2024,\n        feature_min_rows: int = 14,\n    ) -> None:\n        self.writer = LakeWriter(root=lake_root)\n        self.feature_min_rows = max(feature_min_rows, 1)\n        self.feature_generator = LagRollingFeatureGenerator(\n            LagRollingFeatureGenerator.default_specs(),\n            date_col=\"date\",\n            group_cols=[\"geohash\"],\n            seed=feature_seed,\n        )\n\n    def build(self, tenant_id: str, start: datetime, end: datetime) -> FeatureMatrix:\n        orders = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_shopify_orders\")\n        ads_meta = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_meta_ads\")\n        ads_google = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_google_ads\")\n        promos = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_promos\")\n        weather = self._load_latest(f\"{tenant_id}_weather_daily\")\n\n        orders_daily = self._orders_daily(orders)\n        ads_daily = self._ads_daily(ads_meta, ads_google)\n        promos_daily = self._promos_daily(promos)\n        weather_daily = self._weather_daily(weather)\n\n        join_on_geo = (\n            \"geohash\" in orders_daily.columns\n            and \"geohash\" in weather_daily.columns\n            and not orders_daily.get_column(\"geohash\").is_null().all()\n            and not weather_daily.get_column(\"geohash\").is_null().all()\n        )\n\n        if not orders_daily.is_empty():\n            if join_on_geo:\n                frame = orders_daily.join(weather_daily, on=[\"date\", \"geohash\"], how=\"left\")\n            else:\n                frame = orders_daily.join(weather_daily, on=[\"date\"], how=\"left\")\n        else:\n            frame = weather_daily\n\n        if TARGET_COLUMN not in frame.columns:\n            frame = frame.with_columns(pl.lit(None, dtype=pl.Float64).alias(TARGET_COLUMN))\n\n        frame = frame.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").cast(pl.Utf8))\n\n        ads_join = ads_daily.drop([col for col in [\"geohash\"] if col in ads_daily.columns])\n        promos_join = promos_daily.drop([col for col in [\"geohash\"] if col in promos_daily.columns])\n\n        frame = frame.join(ads_join, on=\"date\", how=\"full\", suffix=\"_ads\")\n        if \"date_ads\" in frame.columns:\n            frame = (\n                frame.with_columns(\n                    pl.when(pl.col(\"date\").is_null())\n                    .then(pl.col(\"date_ads\"))\n                    .otherwise(pl.col(\"date\"))\n                    .alias(\"date\")\n                )\n                .drop(\"date_ads\")\n            )\n        frame = frame.join(promos_join, on=\"date\", how=\"full\", suffix=\"_promo\")\n        if \"date_promo\" in frame.columns:\n            frame = (\n                frame.with_columns(\n                    pl.when(pl.col(\"date\").is_null())\n                    .then(pl.col(\"date_promo\"))\n                    .otherwise(pl.col(\"date\"))\n                    .alias(\"date\")\n                )\n                .drop(\"date_promo\")\n            )\n        frame = frame.sort(\"date\")\n        start_str = start.date().isoformat()\n        end_str = end.date().isoformat()\n        frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"date\").is_between(pl.lit(start_str), pl.lit(end_str)))\n\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            pl.col(TARGET_COLUMN).is_not_null().alias(\"target_available\"),\n        )\n\n        numeric_columns = [\n            column\n            for column, dtype in frame.schema.items()\n            if dtype in pl.NUMERIC_DTYPES\n        ]\n        frame = frame.with_columns([pl.col(column).fill_null(0) for column in numeric_columns])\n\n        forward_looking_columns = [\n            column\n            for column in frame.columns\n            if column.endswith(\"_spend\")\n            or column.endswith(\"_conversions\")\n            or column == \"promos_sent\"\n        ]\n        forward_signal_expr = (\n            pl.lit(False)\n            if not forward_looking_columns\n            else pl.any_horizontal(\n                [\n                    pl.col(column).cast(pl.Float64).fill_null(0.0).abs() > 0.0\n                    for column in forward_looking_columns\n                ]\n            )\n        )\n        forward_leakage_expr = (~pl.col(\"target_available\")) & forward_signal_expr\n        forecast_leakage_expr = (\n            pl.col(\"observation_type\")\n            .cast(pl.Utf8)\n            .str.to_lowercase()\n            .eq(\"forecast\")\n            & pl.col(\"target_available\")\n            if \"observation_type\" in frame.columns\n            else pl.lit(False)\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            [\n                forward_leakage_expr.alias(\"_forward_leakage\"),\n                forecast_leakage_expr.alias(\"_forecast_leakage\"),\n            ]\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            (pl.col(\"_forward_leakage\") | pl.col(\"_forecast_leakage\")).alias(\"leakage_risk\")\n        )\n\n        forward_leakage_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"_forward_leakage\"))\n        forward_leakage_rows = int(forward_leakage_frame.height)\n        forward_leakage_dates = (\n            forward_leakage_frame.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if forward_leakage_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        forecast_leakage_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"_forecast_leakage\"))\n        forecast_leakage_rows = int(forecast_leakage_frame.height)\n        forecast_leakage_dates = (\n            forecast_leakage_frame.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if forecast_leakage_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        frame = frame.drop([\"_forward_leakage\", \"_forecast_leakage\"])\n\n        missing = [col for col in REQUIRED_WEATHER_COLS if col not in frame.columns]\n        if missing:\n            raise ValueError(f\"Weather features missing from matrix: {missing}\")\n\n        validate_feature_matrix(frame)\n        profiles: Dict[str, DatasetProfile] = {}\n        try:\n            profiles[\"orders\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"orders\", orders)\n            ads_combined = pl.concat([df for df in (ads_meta, ads_google) if not df.is_empty()], how=\"vertical\") if (not ads_meta.is_empty() or not ads_google.is_empty()) else pl.DataFrame([])\n            profiles[\"ads\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"ads\", ads_combined)\n            profiles[\"promos\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"promos\", promos)\n            profiles[\"weather\"] = build_profile_from_polars(\"weather\", weather)\n        except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - profiling is best-effort\n            profiles = {}\n\n        leakage_rows = frame.filter(pl.col(\"leakage_risk\"))\n        leakage_risk_rows = int(leakage_rows.height)\n        leakage_risk_dates = (\n            leakage_rows.select(pl.col(\"date\"))\n            .unique(maintain_order=True)[\"date\"]\n            .to_list()\n            if leakage_risk_rows > 0\n            else []\n        )\n\n        frame = frame.filter(~pl.col(\"leakage_risk\")) if leakage_risk_rows > 0 else frame\n        if frame.height >= self.feature_min_rows:\n            frame = self.feature_generator.transform(frame)\n        observed_frame = frame.filter(pl.col(\"target_available\"))\n        observed_rows = int(observed_frame.height)\n        max_observed_date = observed_frame[\"date\"].max() if observed_rows > 0 else None\n        latest_observed_date = str(max_observed_date) if isinstance(max_observed_date, str) else max_observed_date\n        matrix = FeatureMatrix(\n            frame=frame,\n            observed_frame=observed_frame,\n            orders_rows=int(orders.height),\n            ads_rows=int(ads_meta.height + ads_google.height),\n            promo_rows=int(promos.height),\n            weather_rows=int(weather.height),\n            observed_rows=observed_rows,\n            latest_observed_date=latest_observed_date,\n            profiles=profiles,\n            leakage_risk_rows=leakage_risk_rows,\n            leakage_risk_dates=[str(date) for date in leakage_risk_dates],\n            forward_leakage_rows=forward_leakage_rows,\n            forward_leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in forward_leakage_dates],\n            forecast_leakage_rows=forecast_leakage_rows,\n            forecast_leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in forecast_leakage_dates],\n        )\n        if leakage_risk_rows > 0:\n            raise FeatureLeakageError(\n                tenant_id,\n                start,\n                end,\n            leakage_rows=leakage_risk_rows,\n                leakage_dates=[str(date) for date in leakage_risk_dates],\n                forward_rows=forward_leakage_rows,\n                forward_dates=matrix.forward_leakage_dates,\n                forecast_rows=forecast_leakage_rows,\n                forecast_dates=matrix.forecast_leakage_dates,\n                matrix=matrix,\n            )\n        return matrix\n\n    def _load_latest(self, dataset: str) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        path = self.writer.latest(dataset)\n        if not path:\n            return pl.DataFrame([])\n        return read_parquet(path)\n\n    def _orders_daily(self, orders: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if orders.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\"date\": [], \"geohash\": [], \"net_revenue\": []})\n        if \"created_at\" not in orders.columns:\n            raise ValueError(\"orders dataset missing `created_at`\")\n        frame = orders.with_columns([\n            pl.col(\"created_at\").str.slice(0, 10).alias(\"date\"),\n            pl.col(\"ship_geohash\").alias(\"geohash\"),\n        ])\n        group_cols = [\"date\", \"geohash\"] if \"ship_geohash\" in orders.columns else [\"date\"]\n        return frame.group_by(group_cols).agg(pl.col(\"net_revenue\").sum())\n\n    def _ads_daily(self, meta: pl.DataFrame, google: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        frames = []\n        if not meta.is_empty():\n            frames.append(\n                meta.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").alias(\"date\"))\n                .group_by(\"date\")\n                .agg([\n                    pl.col(\"spend\").sum().alias(\"meta_spend\"),\n                    pl.col(\"conversions\").sum().alias(\"meta_conversions\"),\n                ])\n                .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n            )\n        if not google.is_empty():\n            frames.append(\n                google.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").alias(\"date\"))\n                .group_by(\"date\")\n                .agg([\n                    pl.col(\"spend\").sum().alias(\"google_spend\"),\n                    pl.col(\"conversions\").sum().alias(\"google_conversions\"),\n                ])\n                .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n            )\n        if not frames:\n            return pl.DataFrame({\n                \"date\": [],\n                \"geohash\": [],\n                \"meta_spend\": [],\n                \"meta_conversions\": [],\n                \"google_spend\": [],\n                \"google_conversions\": [],\n            })\n        return (\n            pl.concat(frames, how=\"align\")\n            .group_by(\"date\")\n            .agg([\n                pl.col(\"meta_spend\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"meta_conversions\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"google_spend\").sum(),\n                pl.col(\"google_conversions\").sum(),\n            ])\n            .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n        )\n\n    def _promos_daily(self, promos: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if promos.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\"date\": [], \"geohash\": [], \"promos_sent\": []})\n        col = \"send_date\" if \"send_date\" in promos.columns else \"scheduled_at\"\n        return (\n            promos\n            .with_columns(pl.col(col).str.slice(0, 10).alias(\"date\"))\n            .group_by(\"date\")\n            .agg(pl.len().alias(\"promos_sent\"))\n            .with_columns(pl.lit(\"GLOBAL\").alias(\"geohash\"))\n        )\n\n    def _weather_daily(self, weather: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.DataFrame:\n        if weather.is_empty():\n            return pl.DataFrame({\n                \"date\": [],\n                \"geohash\": [],\n                \"temp_c\": [],\n                \"precip_mm\": [],\n                \"temp_anomaly\": [],\n                \"precip_anomaly\": [],\n                \"temp_roll7\": [],\n                \"precip_roll7\": [],\n            })\n        missing = REQUIRED_WEATHER_COLS - set(weather.columns)\n        if missing:\n            raise ValueError(f\"Weather dataset missing columns: {missing}\")\n        frame = weather.with_columns(\n            pl.col(\"date\").str.strptime(pl.Date, strict=False).alias(\"date\"),\n        )\n        frame = frame.sort([\"geohash\", \"date\"])\n        frame = frame.with_columns(\n            pl.col(\"temp_c\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=3)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"temp_roll7\"),\n            pl.col(\"precip_mm\")\n            .rolling_mean(window_size=7, min_samples=3)\n            .over(\"geohash\")\n            .alias(\"precip_roll7\"),\n        )\n        frame = frame.with_columns(pl.col(\"date\").cast(pl.Utf8))\n        return frame\n"
}

.unique()\n            .head(COORDINATE_LIMIT)\n        )\n        coords.extend((float(lat), float(lon)) for lat, lon in coord_frame.iter_rows())\n\n    if len(coords) < COORDINATE_LIMIT and   shop_domain = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_SHOP_DOMAIN\")\n    access_token = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_ACCESS_TOKEN\")\n    api_version = os.getenv(\"SHOPIFY_API_VERSION\", \"2024-04\")\n\n    writer =  end_date = context.end_date.date()\n    target_end_date = end_date + timedelta(days=FORECAST_HORIZON_DAYS)\n\n    rows: list[dict[str, Any]] = []\n    sources: dict[str, Any] = {}\n    for lat, lon 15.0,\n                        \"temp_max_c\": 16.0,\n                        \"temp_min_c\": 14.0,\n                        \"apparent_temp_c\": 15.0,\n                        \"precip_mm\": 0.5,\n                        \"precip_probability\": 0.2,\n                        \"humidity_mean\": 0.5,\n                        \"windspeed_max\": 10.0,\n                        \"uv_index_max\": 3.0,\n                        \"snowfall_mm\": 0.0,\n                        \"temp_anomaly\": 0.0,\n                        \"precip_anomaly\": 0.0,\n                        \"temp_roll7\": 15.0,\n                        \"precip_roll7\": 0.5,\n                        \"temp_c_lag1\": None,\n                        \"precip_mm_lag1\": None,\n                        \"uv_index_lag1\": None,\n          \"snow_event_flag\": 0,\n                        \"high_wind_flag\": 0,\n                        \"uv_alert_flag\": 0,\n                        \"high_precip_prob_flag\": 0,\n                        \"observation_type\": \"observed\" if current <= end_date else \"forecast\",\n                        \"as_of_utc\": datetime.utcnow().replace(tzinfo=timezone.utc).isoformat(),\n                    }\n                )\n\n    if rows:\n        df = pl.DataFrame(rows).unique(subset=[\"date\", \"geohash\", \"observation_type\"])\n        df = df.sort([\"date\", \"geohash\", \"weather_path\": str(path),\n        \"rows\": rows,\n        \"cells\": list(sources.keys()),\n        \"sources\": sources,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Build feature matrix\")\nasync def  lake_root: str = \"storage/lake/raw\",\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Building feature matrix for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n    builder =   }\n        matrix = exc.matrix\n        if matrix is None:\n            raise\n        logger.warning(\n            \"Feature leakage guardrail triggered for tenant %s; sanitized %d rows\",\n \"observed_design_matrix\": matrix.observed_frame.to_dict(as_series=False),\n        \"metadata\": {\n            \"start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n            \"end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n            \"orders_rows\": matrix.orders_rows,\n            \"ads_rows\": matrix.ads_rows,\n            \"promo_rows\": matrix.promo_rows,\n            \"weather_rows\": matrix.weather_rows,\n            \"observed_rows\": matrix.observed_rows,\n            \"latest_observed_target_date\": matrix.latest_observed_date,\n            \"leakage_guardrail\": {\n                \"target_available_column\": \"target_available\",\n                \"observed_rows\": matrix.observed_rows,\n                \"total_rows\": int(matrix.frame.height),\n                \"leakage_risk_rows\": matrix.leakage_risk_rows,\n                \"leakage_risk_dates\": matrix.leakage_risk_dates,\n                \"forward_leakage_rows\": matrix.forward_leakage_rows,\n                \"forward_leakage_dates\": matrix.forward_leakage_dates,\n                \"forecast_leakage_rows\": matrix.forecast_leakage_rows,\n                \"forecast_leakage_dates\": matrix.forecast_leakage_dates,\n                \"passes\": matrix.leakage_risk_rows == 0,\n                \"status\": guardrail_status,\n                **guardrail_notes,\n            },\n            \"shopify_summary\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"ads_summary\": ads_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"promo_summary\": promo_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n            \"weather_row_count\": len(weather_payload.get(\"rows\", [])),\n        },\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Fit models\")\nasync def fit_models(feature_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Fitting baseline + MMM models for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    observed_matrix_dict = feature_payload.get(\"observed_design_matrix\")\n    matrix_dict = observed_matrix_dict if observed_matrix_dict is not None else (feature_payload.get(\"design_matrix\") or {})\n    bundle = train_poc_models(matrix_dict)\n\n    return {\n        \"models\": {\n            \"baseline\": {\n                \"coefficients\": bundle.baseline.coefficients,\n                \"intercept\": bundle.baseline.intercept,\n                \"features\": bundle.baseline.features,\n            },\n            \"mmm\": {\n                \"base_roas\": bundle.mmm.base_roas,\n                \"elasticity\": bundle.mmm.elasticity,\n                \"mean_roas\": bundle.mmm.mean_roas,\n                \"mean_spend\": bundle.mmm.mean_spend,\n                \"features\": bundle.mmm.features,\n            },\n            \"timeseries\": {\n                \"features\": bundle.timeseries.features if bundle.timeseries else [],\n                \"target\": bundle.timeseries.target if bundle.timeseries else \"net_revenue\",\n                \"holdout_r2\": bundle.timeseries.holdout_r2 if bundle.timeseries else 0.0,\n                \"cv_scores\": bundle.timeseries.cv_scores if bundle.timeseries else [],\n            },\n        },\n        \"metrics\": bundle.diagnostics,\n        \"quantiles\": bundle.quantiles,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Simulate counterfactuals\")\nasync def simulate_counterfactuals(\n    model_payload: Dict[str, Any], feature_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Simulating counterfactual allocations for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    frame_dict = feature_payload.get(\"design_matrix\") or {}\n    frame = pl.DataFrame(frame_dict)\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return {\"cells\": [], \"total_budget\": 0.0, \"status\": \"DEGRADED\"}\n\n    latest = frame.tail(1)\n    spend_cols = [col for col in frame.columns if col.endswith(\"_spend\")]\n    current_spend = {col.replace(\"_spend\", \"\"): float(latest[0, col]) for col in spend_cols}\n    total_budget = sum(current_spend.values())\n\n    mmm_payload = model_payload.get(\"models\", {}).get(\"mmm\", {})\n    mean_roas_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"mean_roas\", {}) or {}\n    mean_spend_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"mean_spend\", {}) or {}\n    elasticity_lookup = mmm_payload.get(\"elasticity\", {}) or {}\n    base_roas = float(mmm_payload.get(\"base_roas\", 1.0))\n\n    guardrails = Guardrails(\n        min_spend=0.0,\n        max_spend=max(current_spend.values() or [0.0]) * 1.5 + 1e-6,\n        roas_floor=0.5,\n        learning_cap=0.25,\n    )\n\n    if guardrails.max_spend < guardrails.min_spend:\n        guardrails.max_spend = guardrails.min_spend\n\n    def _roas_for(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        feature = f\"{cell}_spend\"\n        base = float(mean_roas_lookup.get(feature, base_roas))\n        mean_spend_val = float(mean_spend_lookup.get(feature, current_spend.get(cell, 0.0) or guardrails.min_spend or 1.0))\n        elasticity = float(elasticity_lookup.get(feature, 0.0))\n        if mean_spend_val <= 0:\n            return max(base, 0.0)\n        ratio = (spend - mean_spend_val) / max(mean_spend_val, 1e-6)\n        roas = base + elasticity * ratio\n        if not np.isfinite(roas):  # type: ignore[attr-defined]\n            roas = base\n        return max(roas, 0.0)\n\n    roi_curves: Dict[str, List[Dict[str, float]]] = {}\n    expected_roas: Dict[str, float] = {}\n\n    for cell, spend in current_spend.items():\n        candidates = {\n            0.0,\n            guardrails.min_spend,\n            guardrails.max_spend,\n            spend,\n            spend * 0.5,\n            spend * 0.75,\n            spend * 1.25,\n            spend * 1.5,\n        }\n        sanitized: List[float] = []\n        for value in candidates:\n            if value < 0:\n                continue\n            capped = min(max(value, guardrails.min_spend), guardrails.max_spend)\n            sanitized.append(round(capped, 6))\n        sanitized = sorted(set(sanitized))\n        if not sanitized or sanitized[0] > 0.0:\n            sanitized.insert(0, 0.0)\n\n        curve_points: List[Dict[str, float]] = []\n        for candidate in sanitized:\n            roas = _roas_for(cell, candidate)\n            curve_points.append({\n                \"spend\": candidate,\n                \"roas\": roas,\n                \"revenue\": roas * candidate,\n            })\n        roi_curves[cell] = curve_points\n\n        baseline_spend = spend if spend > 0 else max(guardrails.min_spend, 1.0)\n        expected_roas[cell] = max(_roas_for(cell, baseline_spend), 0.1)\n\n    return {\n        \"cells\": list(current_spend.keys()),\n        \"total_budget\": total_budget,\n        \"current_spend\": current_spend,\n        \"expected_roas\": expected_roas,\n        \"guardrails\": guardrails,\n        \"metrics\": model_payload.get(\"metrics\", {}),\n        \"roi_curves\": roi_curves,\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Allocate budgets\")\nasync def allocate_budget(\n    model_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    simulation_payload: Dict[str, Any],\n    context: TenantContext,\n    context_tags: Optional[List[str]] = None,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Optimising budget allocation for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n\n    cells = simulation_payload.get(\"cells\", [])\n    if not cells:\n        return {\"plan\": [], \"guardrails\": {}, \"status\": \"DEGRADED\"}\n\n    quantiles = model_payload.get(\"quantiles\", {}).get(\"expected_revenue\", {}) or {}\n    metrics = model_payload.get(\"metrics\", {})\n    allocation = allocate(\n        AllocationInput(\n            cells=cells,\n            total_budget=float(simulation_payload.get(\"total_budget\", 0.0)),\n            current_spend=simulation_payload.get(\"current_spend\", {}),\n            expected_roas=simulation_payload.get(\"expected_roas\", {}),\n            roi_curves=simulation_payload.get(\"roi_curves\", {}),\n            guardrails=simulation_payload.get(\"guardrails\"),\n            context_tags=context_tags or [],\n            quantile_factors=quantiles,\n            risk_aversion=_risk_from_metrics(metrics),\n        )\n    )\n    confidence = _confidence_from_metrics(metrics)\n    confidence_value = confidence.value\n\n    roi_curves = simulation_payload.get(\"roi_curves\", {})\n    expected_roas_lookup = simulation_payload.get(\"expected_roas\", {})\n\n    def _interp(points: List[Dict[str, float]], spend: float, key: str) -> float:\n        sorted_points = sorted(points, key=lambda entry: entry.get(\"spend\", 0.0))\n        if not sorted_points:\n            return 0.0\n        if spend <= sorted_points[0][\"spend\"]:\n            first = sorted_points[0]\n            if len(sorted_points) == 1:\n                return float(first.get(key, 0.0))\n            second = sorted_points[1]\n            span = second[\"spend\"] - first[\"spend\"]\n            if span == 0:\n                return float(first.get(key, 0.0))\n            weight = (spend - first[\"spend\"]) / span\n            return float(first.get(key, 0.0) + weight * (second.get(key, 0.0) - first.get(key, 0.0)))\n\n        for idx in range(1, len(sorted_points)):\n            prev = sorted_points[idx - 1]\n            curr = sorted_points[idx]\n            if spend <= curr[\"spend\"]:\n                span = curr[\"spend\"] - prev[\"spend\"]\n                if span == 0:\n                    return float(curr.get(key, prev.get(key, 0.0)))\n                weight = (spend - prev[\"spend\"]) / span\n                return float(prev.get(key, 0.0) + weight * (curr.get(key, 0.0) - prev.get(key, 0.0)))\n\n        last = sorted_points[-1]\n        if len(sorted_points) == 1:\n            return float(last.get(key, 0.0))\n        prev = sorted_points[-2]\n        span = last[\"spend\"] - prev[\"spend\"]\n        slope = (last.get(key, 0.0) - prev.get(key, 0.0)) / span if span else 0.0\n        return float(last.get(key, 0.0) + slope * (spend - last[\"spend\"]))\n\n    def _revenue_from_curve(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        points = roi_curves.get(cell)\n        if not points:\n            return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0) * spend\n        return _interp(points, spend, \"revenue\")\n\n    def _roas_from_curve(cell: str, spend: float) -> float:\n        points = roi_curves.get(cell)\n        if not points:\n            return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0)\n        roas = _interp(points, spend, \"roas\")\n        if spend > 0:\n            return max(roas, 0.0)\n        return expected_roas_lookup.get(cell, 1.0)\n\n    slices = []\n    for cell, spend in allocation.spends.items():\n        revenue_mid = _revenue_from_curve(cell, spend)\n        p50_factor = quantiles.get(\"p50\") or 1.0\n        if p50_factor <= 0:\n            p50_factor = 1.0\n        scale = revenue_mid / p50_factor if p50_factor else revenue_mid\n        revenue_p10 = max(0.0, (quantiles.get(\"p10\") or p50_factor) * scale)\n        revenue_p50 = max(0.0, p50_factor * scale)\n        revenue_p90 = max(0.0, (quantiles.get(\"p90\") or p50_factor) * scale)\n        roas_quantiles = {\n            \"p10\": revenue_p10 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n            \"p50\": revenue_p50 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n            \"p90\": revenue_p90 / spend if spend else 0.0,\n        }\n        slices.append(\n            {\n                \"cell\": cell,\n                \"recommended_spend\": spend,\n                \"expected_revenue\": {\n                    \"p10\": revenue_p10,\n                    \"p50\": revenue_p50,\n                    \"p90\": revenue_p90,\n                },\n                \"expected_roas\": roas_quantiles,\n                \"confidence\": confidence_value,\n                \"assumptions\": [\"Spend change <=25%\", \"ROAS floor 0.5\"],\n                \"rationale\": {\n                    \"primary_driver\": \"Weather & elasticity uplift\",\n                    \"supporting_factors\": [f\"Holdout R²: {metrics.get('holdout_r2', 0.0):.2f}\"],\n                    \"confidence_level\": confidence_value,\n                    \"data_quality\": \"FULL\" if metrics.get('row_count', 0) > 0 else \"DEGRADED\",\n                    \"assumptions\": [\"Quantile scaling\"],\n                    \"risks\": [\"Forecast error\", \"Inventory limits\"],\n                },\n                \"status\": \"FULL\" if allocation.diagnostics.get(\"success\") else \"DEGRADED\",\n            }\n        )\n\n    validate_plan_slices(slices)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"confidence\"] = confidence_value\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"mae\"] = float(metrics.get(\"mae\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"rmse\"] = float(metrics.get(\"rmse\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"bias\"] = float(metrics.get(\"bias\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"prediction_std\"] = float(metrics.get(\"prediction_std\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    allocation.diagnostics[\"quantile_width\"] = float(metrics.get(\"quantile_width\", 0.0) or 0.0)\n    return {\n        \"plan\": slices,\n        \"guardrails\": allocation.diagnostics,\n        \"status\": \"FULL\" if allocation.diagnostics.get(\"success\") else \"DEGRADED\",\n    }\n\n\n@task(name=\"Generate PoC report\")\nasync def generate_poc_report(plan_payload: Dict[str, Any], context: TenantContext) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    logger = get_run_logger()\n    logger.info(\"Rendering PoC report for tenant %s\", context.tenant_id)\n    return {\"report_path\": f\"poc_reports/{context.tenant_id}/latest\"}\n\n\n@flow(name=\"weathervane-poc-pipeline\")\nasync def orchestrate_poc_flow(\n    tenant_id: str,\n    start_date: Optional[datetime] = None,\n    end_date: Optional[datetime] = None,\n) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"Run the end-to-end Plan & Proof pipeline for a tenant in read-only mode.\"\"\"\n\n    if end_date is None:\n        end_date = datetime.utcnow()\n    if start_date is None:\n        start_date = end_date - timedelta(days=DEFAULT_LOOKBACK_DAYS)\n\n    context = TenantContext(tenant_id=tenant_id, start_date=start_date, end_date=end_date)\n\n    lake_root = os.getenv(\"STORAGE_LAKE_ROOT\", \"storage/lake/raw\")\n    weather_root = os.getenv(\"STORAGE_WEATHER_ROOT\", \"storage/lake/weather\")\n\n    shopify_payload = await fetch_shopify_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    ads_payload = await fetch_ads_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    promo_payload = await fetch_promo_data(context, lake_root=lake_root)\n    incrementality_design = await design_geo_incrementality_experiment(shopify_payload, context)\n    weather_payload = await fetch_weather_data(\n        context,\n        shopify_payload,\n        cache_root=weather_root,\n        lake_root=lake_root,\n    )\n    weather_source = _derive_weather_source(weather_payload)\n    features = await build_feature_matrix(shopify_payload, ads_payload, promo_payload, weather_payload, context, lake_root=lake_root)\n\n    tag_metadata = {\n        \"weather_source\": weather_source,\n        \"dataset_rows\": {\n            \"orders\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"orders_rows\"),\n            \"ads\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"ads_rows\"),\n            \"promos\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"promo_rows\"),\n            \"weather\": features.get(\"metadata\", {}).get(\"weather_row_count\"),\n        },\n        \"orders_geocoded_ratio\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}).get(\"orders_geocoded_ratio\"),\n        \"incrementality_design\": incrementality_design,\n    }\n\n    context_tags = default_context_service.derive_tags(context.tenant_id, tag_metadata)\n\n    models = await fit_models(features, context)\n    simulations = await simulate_counterfactuals(models, features, context)\n    plan = await allocate_budget(models, simulations, context, context_tags=context_tags)\n    report = await generate_poc_report(plan, context)\n\n    context_snapshot = default_context_service.snapshot(\n        context.tenant_id,\n        metadata={\n            \"window\": {\n                \"start\": context.start_date.isoformat(),\n                \"end\": context.end_date.isoformat(),\n            },\n            **tag_metadata,\n        },\n    )\n\n    geocoding_validation = evaluate_geocoding_coverage(\n        context.tenant_id,\n        lake_root=lake_root,\n    )\n\n    return {\n        \"context\": context,\n        \"plan\": plan,\n        \"report\": report,\n        \"data_context\": context_snapshot.to_dict(),\n        \"geocoding_validation\": geocoding_validation.to_dict(),\n        \"shopify_summary\": shopify_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"ads_summary\": ads_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"promo_summary\": promo_payload.get(\"summary\", {}),\n        \"sources\": {\n            \"shopify\": shopify_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"ads\": ads_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"promo\": promo_payload.get(\"source\"),\n            \"weather\": weather_payload.get(\"source\"),\n        },\n        \"incrementality_design\": incrementality_design,\n    }\n"
}

```json
{
  "path": "apps/model/pipelines/poc_models.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"High-level modelling pipeline used by the PoC flow.\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom typing import Dict\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\n\nfrom apps.model.baseline import BaselineModel, fit_baseline_model, evaluate_r2\nfrom apps.model.mmm import MMMModel, fit_mmm_model\nfrom apps.model.ts_training import FitResult, fit_timeseries\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass ModelBundle:\n    baseline: BaselineModel\n    mmm: MMMModel\n    diagnostics: Dict[str, float]\n    quantiles: Dict[str, Dict[str, float]]\n    timeseries: FitResult | None\n\n\ndef train_poc_models(matrix: Dict[str, list], target: str = \"net_revenue\") -> ModelBundle:\n    frame = pl.DataFrame(matrix)\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        empty_model = BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=0.0, features=[], target=target)\n        return ModelBundle(\n            baseline=empty_model,\n            mmm=MMMModel(base_roas=0.0, elasticity={}, mean_roas={}, mean_spend={}, features=[]),\n            diagnostics={\n                \"row_count\": 0.0,\n                \"feature_columns\": 0.0,\n                \"baseline_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"timeseries_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"average_roas\": 0.0,\n                \"cv_mean\": 0.0,\n                \"holdout_r2\": 0.0,\n                \"mae\": 0.0,\n                \"rmse\": 0.0,\n                \"bias\": 0.0,\n                \"prediction_std\": 0.0,\n                \"quantile_width\": 0.0,\n            },\n            quantiles={\"expected_revenue\": {\"p10\": 1.0, \"p50\": 1.0, \"p90\": 1.0}},\n            timeseries=None,\n        )\n\n    feature_cols = [\n        col\n        for col in frame.columns\n        if col != target and frame[col].dtype in (pl.Float64, pl.Float32, pl.Int64, pl.Int32)\n    ]\n    baseline = fit_baseline_model(frame, target=target, features=feature_cols)\n\n    ts_frame = frame.select([\"date\"] + feature_cols + [target])\n    ts_result = fit_timeseries(ts_frame, \"date\", target, feature_cols)\n    ts_features = frame.select(feature_cols)\n    ts_predictions = ts_result.model.predict(ts_features.to_numpy())\n\n    spend_cols = [col for col in frame.columns if \"spend\" in col]\n    mmm = fit_mmm_model(frame, spend_cols=spend_cols, revenue_col=target)\n\n    actuals = frame[target].to_numpy()\n    residuals = actuals - ts_predictions\n\n    with np.errstate(divide=\"ignore\", invalid=\"ignore\"):\n        prediction_safe = np.where(np.abs(ts_predictions) < 1e-6, 1.0, ts_predictions)\n        ratio_residuals = residuals / prediction_safe\n    distribution = np.clip(1.0 + ratio_residuals, 0.0, None)\n    q10 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.10))\n    q50 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.50))\n    q90 = float(np.quantile(distribution, 0.90))\n\n    mae = float(np.mean(np.abs(residuals)))\n    rmse = float(np.sqrt(np.mean(residuals ** 2)))\n    bias = float(np.mean(residuals))\n    quantile_width = q90 - q10\n    prediction_std = float(np.std(ts_predictions))\n    timeseries_r2 = float(ts_result.model.score(ts_features.to_numpy(), actuals))\n\n    diagnostics = {\n        \"row_count\": float(frame.height),\n        \"feature_columns\": float(len(feature_cols)),\n        \"baseline_r2\": evaluate_r2(baseline, frame),\n        \"timeseries_r2\": timeseries_r2,\n        \"average_roas\": mmm.base_roas,\n        \"cv_mean\": float(np.mean(ts_result.cv_scores) if ts_result.cv_scores else 0.0),\n        \"holdout_r2\": ts_result.holdout_r2,\n        \"mae\": mae,\n        \"rmse\": rmse,\n        \"bias\": bias,\n        \"prediction_std\": prediction_std,\n        \"quantile_width\": quantile_width,\n    }\n    quantiles = {\"expected_revenue\": {\"p10\": q10, \"p50\": q50, \"p90\": q90}}\n    return ModelBundle(\n        baseline=baseline,\n        mmm=mmm,\n        diagnostics=diagnostics,\n        quantiles=quantiles,\n        timeseries=ts_result,\n    )\n"
}

{
  "path": "apps/model/baseline.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Baseline + weather modelling utilities.\n\nWe train a weather-aware Generalised Additive Model (GAM) when pyGAM is available and\nfall back to a deterministic linear regression otherwise. The GAM captures smooth\nnon-linear relationships for weather + marketing signals, along with limited\ninteractions, while respecting small-sample guardrails so that scaffolding tests can\ncontinue to run without the optional dependency.\n\"\"\"\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nimport itertools\nimport subprocess\nimport sys\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom typing import Any, Dict, Iterable, List, Sequence\n\nimport numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\n\nLinearGAM: Any | None = None\ns: Any | None = None\nte: Any | None = None\n_PYGAM_INITIALISED = False\n\n\ndef _ensure_pygam_loaded() -> None:\n    \"\"\"Attempt to import pyGAM in a crash-safe way.\n\n    Some sandboxed environments ship partial pyGAM builds that segfault during import.\n    We first probe the dependency in a subprocess so the main interpreter survives\n    those failures and can fall back to linear regression.\n    \"\"\"\n    global LinearGAM, s, te, _PYGAM_INITIALISED\n    if _PYGAM_INITIALISED:\n        return\n    _PYGAM_INITIALISED = True\n    try:\n        result = subprocess.run(  # pragma: no cover - defensive subprocess probe\n            [sys.executable, \"-c\", \"import pygam\"],\n            stdout=subprocess.DEVNULL,\n            stderr=subprocess.DEVNULL,\n            check=False,\n            timeout=5,\n        )\n        if result.returncode != 0:\n            return\n        from pygam import LinearGAM as _LinearGAM, s as _s, te as _te\n    except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - pyGAM missing or unsafe\n        return\n    LinearGAM = _LinearGAM\n    s = _s\n    te = _te\n\n\n_ensure_pygam_loaded()\n\n\nNUMERIC_DTYPES = {\n    pl.Float64,\n    pl.Float32,\n    pl.Int64,\n    pl.Int32,\n    pl.Int16,\n    pl.Int8,\n    pl.UInt64,\n    pl.UInt32,\n    pl.UInt16,\n    pl.UInt8,\n}\n\nWEATHER_KEYWORDS = (\"temp\", \"precip\", \"humidity\", \"uv\", \"wind\", \"snow\")\nMARKETING_KEYWORDS = (\"spend\", \"budget\", \"roas\", \"impression\", \"click\", \"promo\")\nMAX_INTERACTIONS = 3\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass BaselineModel:\n    coefficients: Dict[str, float]\n    intercept: float\n    features: List[str]\n    target: str\n    gam: Any | None = None\n\n    def predict(self, frame: pl.DataFrame) -> pl.Series:\n        if self.gam is not None and self.features:\n            missing = [feature for feature in self.features if feature not in frame.columns]\n            if missing:\n                raise KeyError(f\"Missing features required for prediction: {missing}\")\n            X = frame.select(self.features).to_numpy()\n\n            preds = self.gam.predict(X)\n            return pl.Series(name=\"prediction\", values=np.asarray(preds))\n\n        prediction = pl.lit(self.intercept)\n        for feature, coef in self.coefficients.items():\n            if feature in frame.columns:\n                prediction = prediction + pl.col(feature) * coef\n        return frame.select(prediction.alias(\"prediction\")).to_series()\n\n\ndef fit_baseline_model(frame: pl.DataFrame, target: str, features: List[str]) -> BaselineModel:\n    _ensure_pygam_loaded()\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=0.0, features=[], target=target)\n\n    usable_features = [feature for feature in features if feature in frame.columns]\n    if not usable_features:\n        intercept = _safe_mean(frame, target)\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=intercept, features=[], target=target)\n\n    df = frame.select([target] + usable_features).drop_nulls()\n    if df.is_empty():\n        intercept = _safe_mean(frame, target)\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=intercept, features=[], target=target)\n\n    cleaned_features = _filter_features(df, usable_features)\n    if not cleaned_features:\n        intercept = _safe_mean(df, target)\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=intercept, features=[], target=target)\n\n    row_count = df.height\n\n    if LinearGAM and s and te and row_count >= _min_gam_rows(len(cleaned_features)):\n        gam = _fit_gam(df, target, cleaned_features)\n        if gam is not None:\n            return BaselineModel(\n                coefficients={},\n                intercept=float(gam.statistics_[\"intercept\"] if \"intercept\" in gam.statistics_ else gam.coef_[0]),\n                features=cleaned_features,\n                target=target,\n                gam=gam,\n            )\n\n    # Fallback: simple linear regression via numpy lstsq.\n    y = df[target].to_numpy()\n    if not cleaned_features:\n        intercept = float(np.mean(y)) if len(y) else 0.0\n        return BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=intercept, features=[], target=target)\n\n    X = np.column_stack([np.ones(len(df))] + [df[col].to_numpy() for col in cleaned_features])\n    coef, *_ = np.linalg.lstsq(X, y, rcond=None)\n    intercept = float(coef[0])\n    coefficients = {feature: float(value) for feature, value in zip(cleaned_features, coef[1:])}\n    return BaselineModel(coefficients=coefficients, intercept=intercept, features=cleaned_features, target=target)\n\n\n\ndef evaluate_r2(model: BaselineModel, frame: pl.DataFrame) -> float:\n    if frame.is_empty():\n        return 0.0\n    target = model.target\n    if target not in frame.columns:\n        return 0.0\n    df = frame.select([target] + model.features).drop_nulls() if model.features else frame.select([target]).drop_nulls()\n    if df.is_empty():\n        return 0.0\n    y = df[target].to_numpy()\n    if model.gam is not None and model.features:\n        preds = model.gam.predict(df.select(model.features).to_numpy())\n    else:\n        preds = np.full_like(y, model.intercept, dtype=float)\n        for feature in model.features:\n            preds = preds + model.coefficients.get(feature, 0.0) * df[feature].to_numpy()\n    ss_tot = float(((y - y.mean()) ** 2).sum())\n    ss_res = float(((y - preds) ** 2).sum())\n    return float(1 - ss_res / ss_tot) if ss_tot else 0.0\n\n\ndef _min_gam_rows(feature_count: int) -> int:\n    return max(24, feature_count * 4)\n\n\ndef _filter_features(df: pl.DataFrame, features: Sequence[str]) -> List[str]:\n    cleaned: List[str] = []\n    for feature in features:\n        series = df.get_column(feature)\n        if series.dtype not in NUMERIC_DTYPES:\n            continue\n        if series.null_count() >= df.height:\n            continue\n        if series.n_unique() <= 1:\n            continue\n        cleaned.append(feature)\n    return cleaned\n\n\ndef _fit_gam(df: pl.DataFrame, target: str, features: Sequence[str]) -> LinearGAM | None:\n    if LinearGAM is None or s is None:\n        return None\n    X = df.select(features).to_numpy()\n    y = df[target].to_numpy()\n    if not np.isfinite(X).all() or not np.isfinite(y).all():\n        return None\n\n    row_count = df.height\n    gam = _build_gam(features, row_count)\n    lam_grid = np.logspace(-2, 2, num=4)\n    weights = np.clip(np.abs(y), 1.0, None)\n    try:\n        gam = gam.gridsearch(X, y, weights=weights, lam=lam_grid, progress=False)\n    except Exception:  # pragma: no cover - fall back to direct fit\n        try:\n            gam.fit(X, y, weights=weights)\n        except Exception:\n            return None\n    return gam\n\n\ndef _build_gam(features: Sequence[str], row_count: int) -> LinearGAM:\n    assert LinearGAM is not None and s is not None  # Guarded by caller.\n    terms = []\n    weather_indices: List[int] = []\n    marketing_indices: List[int] = []\n    for idx, name in enumerate(features):\n        lowered = name.lower()\n        is_weather = _matches_any(lowered, WEATHER_KEYWORDS)\n        is_marketing = _matches_any(lowered, MARKETING_KEYWORDS)\n        splines = _n_splines(row_count, 12 if is_weather else 8)\n        terms.append(s(idx, n_splines=splines, spline_order=3))\n        if is_weather:\n            weather_indices.append(idx)\n        if is_marketing:\n            marketing_indices.append(idx)\n    if te and weather_indices and marketing_indices:\n        for weather_idx, marketing_idx in itertools.islice(\n            itertools.product(weather_indices, marketing_indices),\n            MAX_INTERACTIONS,\n        ):\n            terms.append(te(weather_idx, marketing_idx, n_splines=[5, 5], spline_order=[3, 3]))\n    return LinearGAM(terms=terms, max_iter=200)\n\n\ndef _matches_any(text: str, keywords: Iterable[str]) -> bool:\n    return any(keyword in text for keyword in keywords)\n\n\ndef _n_splines(row_count: int, preferred: int) -> int:\n    upper = max(6, min(preferred, row_count - 1))\n    return max(4, upper)\n\n\ndef _safe_mean(frame: pl.DataFrame, column: str) -> float:\n    if column not in frame.columns or frame[column].null_count() == frame.height:\n        return 0.0\n    return float(frame[column].fill_null(0.0).mean())\n"
}

{
  "path": "tests/apps/model/test_baseline.py",
  "content": "import numpy as np\nimport polars as pl\nimport pytest\n\nfrom apps.model.baseline import (\n    BaselineModel,\n    LinearGAM,\n    evaluate_r2,\n    fit_baseline_model,\n)\n\n\n@pytest.mark.skipif(LinearGAM is None, reason=\"pyGAM optional dependency not available\")\ndef test_fit_baseline_model_trains_gam_with_weather_signals() -> None:\n    rng = np.random.default_rng(42)\n    rows = 120\n    temp_c = rng.normal(loc=18.0, scale=5.0, size=rows)\n    temp_anomaly = temp_c - temp_c.mean()\n    temp_roll7 = temp_c + rng.normal(scale=0.8, size=rows)\n    precip_mm = rng.gamma(shape=2.5, scale=1.2, size=rows)\n    precip_anomaly = precip_mm - precip_mm.mean()\n    precip_roll7 = precip_mm + rng.normal(scale=0.6, size=rows)\n    meta_spend = rng.normal(loc=65.0, scale=8.0, size=rows)\n    google_spend = rng.normal(loc=42.0, scale=6.5, size=rows)\n    promos_sent = rng.poisson(lam=1.5, size=rows).astype(float)\n\n    # Weather interacts with marketing performance: hot spikes dampen Meta returns, rain helps promos.\n    interaction = -0.12 * temp_anomaly * (meta_spend / 50.0) + 0.08 * precip_anomaly * (promos_sent + 1.0)\n    net_revenue = (\n        180.0\n        + 2.4 * meta_spend\n        + 1.8 * google_spend\n        - 3.0 * np.clip(temp_c - 28.0, a_min=0.0, a_max=None)\n        - 1.6 * precip_mm\n        + interaction\n        + rng.normal(scale=12.0, size=rows)\n    )\n\n    frame = pl.DataFrame(\n        {\n            \"net_revenue\": net_revenue,\n            \"temp_c\": temp_c,\n            \"temp_anomaly\": temp_anomaly,\n            \"temp_roll7\": temp_roll7,\n            \"precip_mm\": precip_mm,\n            \"precip_anomaly\": precip_anomaly,\n            \"precip_roll7\": precip_roll7,\n            \"meta_spend\": meta_spend,\n            \"google_spend\": google_spend,\n            \"promos_sent\": promos_sent,\n        }\n    )\n    features = [col for col in frame.columns if col != \"net_revenue\"]\n\n    model = fit_baseline_model(frame, target=\"net_revenue\", features=features)\n\n    assert model.gam is not None\n    assert set(model.features) == set(features)\n\n    r2 = evaluate_r2(model, frame)\n    assert r2 > 0.8\n\n\ndef test_fit_baseline_model_falls_back_to_linear_for_small_sample() -> None:\n    frame = pl.DataFrame(\n        {\n            \"net_revenue\": [100.0, 105.0, 103.0, 110.0],\n            \"temp_c\": [18.0, 19.0, 20.0, 21.0],\n            \"meta_spend\": [50.0, 52.0, 53.0, 55.0],\n        }\n    )\n    model = fit_baseline_model(frame, target=\"net_revenue\", features=[\"temp_c\", \"meta_spend\"])\n\n    assert model.gam is None\n    assert model.coefficients\n    preds = model.predict(frame)\n    assert isinstance(preds, pl.Series)\n\n\ndef test_evaluate_r2_handles_missing_target_column() -> None:\n    model = BaselineModel(coefficients={}, intercept=10.0, features=[], target=\"net_revenue\")\n    frame = pl.DataFrame({\"meta_spend\": [50.0, 52.0]})\n    assert evaluate_r2(model, frame) == 0.0\n"
}

[{"text":"📂 docs/models/baseline.md

```json
{
  "path": "docs/models/baseline.md",
  "content": "# Weather-Aware Baseline GAM\n\n## Objective\nThe baseline model provides fast, explainable revenue forecasts that respond to weather volatility and marketing inputs. It anchors downstream allocators and benchmarking dashboards by capturing:\n- Smooth non-linear responses to temperature and precipitation anomalies.\n- Interactions between weather shifts and paid spend.\n- Seasonality encoded in the feature store’s lag/rolling generators.\n- Guardrails to avoid leakage, overfitting, and brittle coefficients when data is sparse.\n\n## Data Contract\nInput matrices come from `shared.feature_store.FeatureBuilder` and must contain at minimum:\n- `net_revenue` target.\n- Weather columns: `temp_c`, `temp_anomaly`, `temp_roll7`, `precip_mm`, `precip_anomaly`, `precip_roll7`.\n- Marketing intensity columns such as `*_spend`, `*_conversions`, or promo counts.\nWe drop rows with nulls across the selected features and filter out degenerate columns (non-numeric or single unique value) before fitting.\n\n## Modelling Stack\n1. **Primary learner – pyGAM LinearGAM**\n   - Uses additive smoothers for every numeric feature (`s()` terms).\n   - Weather signals receive higher spline capacity (up to 12 knots) to let the model capture threshold effects (e.g., heat domes, rain-outs).\n   - Up to three tensor interaction terms (`te()`) couple weather and marketing spend so we can model scenario-dependent ROAS shifts.\n   - Regularisation (`λ`) is tuned using a small log-spaced grid via `gam.gridsearch` with absolute-revenue weights (`|y|` clipped to ≥1) to stabilise heteroskedastic tenants.\n   - Iterations capped at 200 to keep training deterministic in CI.\n2. **Fallback – deterministic linear regression**\n   - Engaged when pyGAM is unavailable or the dataset is too small (< `max(24, 4 * feature_count)` rows).\n   - Solved with `numpy.linalg.lstsq` to maintain compatibility with legacy scaffolding tests.\n   - Reverts to an intercept-only mean model when no usable features remain.\n\n## Evaluation Utilities\n`evaluate_r2` recomputes R² on any Polars frame by replaying the GAM or linear coefficients. For GAMs we call `gam.predict` directly; the fallback path reconstructs predictions from the stored intercept and coefficients. Both branches drop rows with null targets to protect telemetry jobs.\n\n## Operational Considerations\n- **Feature hygiene:** We explicitly require numeric dtypes and ≥2 distinct values per feature. This protects the GAM solver from singular basis matrices and keeps the linear fallback stable.\n- **Leakage mitigation:** The upstream feature builder strips forecast/forward-looking rows. The baseline’s guardrails assume that invariant.\n- **Explainability:** pyGAM supports partial dependence and marginal effects out of the box; we retain the fitted `gam` object in `BaselineModel` so future services can expose those diagnostics (e.g., via `gam.partial_dependence`).\n- **Runtime:** The grid search and smoothers complete in <1s for typical 6–12 month daily slices in local testing. If longer runs arise, queue them with the heavy-job infra before productionising.\n\n## Next Steps\n1. Export marginal effects + confidence bands for UI and allocator introspection.\n2. Layer in hierarchical pooling (geo × category) once tenant coverage broadens.\n3. Extend interaction search to include humidity, wind, and promo cadence, gated by causal reviews.\n\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

{
  "path": "shared/libs/storage/lake.py",
  "content": "from __future__ import annotations\n\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom datetime import datetime\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Any, Mapping, Sequence\n\nimport polars as pl\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass LakeWriter:\n    root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/lake/raw\")\n\n    def __post_init__(self) -> None:\n        self.root = Path(self.root)\n        self.root.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n\n    def write_records(self, dataset: str, records: Sequence[Mapping[str, Any]]) -> Path:\n        \"\"\"Persist records to Parquet under storage/lake/raw/<dataset>/timestamp.parquet.\n\n        This is a convenience shim for the prototype: downstream consumers can read\n        the latest Parquet file for a dataset. In production we may evolve to Delta Lake\n        or Iceberg—but the API stays similar.\n        \"\"\"\n\n        if not records:\n            # Create an empty frame with no rows to keep pipeline consistent.\n            frame = pl.DataFrame([])\n        else:\n            frame = pl.DataFrame(records)\n\n        dataset_dir = self.root / dataset\n        dataset_dir.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        timestamp = datetime.utcnow().isoformat().replace(\":\", \"-\")\n        path = dataset_dir / f\"{timestamp}.parquet\"\n        frame.write_parquet(path, compression=\"zstd\")\n        return path\n\n    def latest(self, dataset: str) -> Path | None:\n        dataset_dir = self.root / dataset\n        if not dataset_dir.exists():\n            return None\n        parquet_files = sorted(dataset_dir.glob(\"*.parquet\"), key=lambda p: p.stat().st_mtime, reverse=True)\n        return parquet_files[0] if parquet_files else None\n\n\ndef read_parquet(path: Path) -> pl.DataFrame:\n    return pl.read_parquet(path)\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]

{
  "path": "shared/libs/storage/state.py",
  "content": "\"\"\"Simple JSON-backed state store for connector cursors and metadata.\"\"\"\n\nfrom __future__ import annotations\n\nimport json\nfrom dataclasses import dataclass\nfrom pathlib import Path\nfrom typing import Any, MutableMapping\n\n\n@dataclass\nclass JsonStateStore:\n    root: Path | str = Path(\"storage/metadata/state\")\n\n    def __post_init__(self) -> None:\n        self.root = Path(self.root)\n        self.root.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n\n    def load(self, namespace: str, key: str) -> dict[str, Any]:\n        path = self._path(namespace, key)\n        if not path.exists():\n            return {}\n        try:\n            return json.loads(path.read_text())\n        except json.JSONDecodeError:\n            return {}\n\n    def save(self, namespace: str, key: str, payload: MutableMapping[str, Any]) -> Path:\n        path = self._path(namespace, key)\n        path.parent.mkdir(parents=True, exist_ok=True)\n        path.write_text(json.dumps(dict(payload), indent=2, sort_keys=True))\n        return path\n\n    def list(self, namespace: str) -> list[str]:\n        ns_path = self.root / namespace\n        if not ns_path.exists():\n            return []\n        return sorted(p.stem for p in ns_path.glob(\"*.json\"))\n\n    def _path(self, namespace: str, key: str) -> Path:\n        safe_namespace = namespace.replace(\"/\", \"-\")\n        safe_key = key.replace(\"/\", \"-\")\n        return self.root / safe_namespace / f\"{safe_key}.json\"\n"
}
```","type":"text"}]
